Mohammed Shami returns for India's T20I series against England - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Mohammed Shami Returns for India's T20I Series Against England

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Fast bowler Mohammed Shami has made a comeback to the India squad for the upcoming T20I series against England starting January 22 in Kolkata, after recovering from injury.

  • Shami last played for India in the ODI World Cup final in November 2023 and has undergone ankle surgery.
  • The T20I series will be led by Suryakumar Yadav.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant are notable exclusions from the squad due to injuries and rest.
  • The series includes five matches in various Indian cities followed by three ODIs in February.
“Mohammed Shami returns after key surgeries, aiming for a strong performance in the T20I series.”

The return of Mohammed Shami to the squad adds depth to India's bowling attack as they prepare to face England in the upcoming T20I series.
newTitle: Mohammed Shami Returns for India's T20I Series Against England

title: India’s squad for T20I series against England announced - BCCI
summary:
India’s squad for T20I series against England announced

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: BCCI

The Men’s Selection Committee has picked India’s 15-member squad for the upcoming IDFC First Bank five-match T20I series against England starting from 22nd January in Kolkata.

  • Captain: Suryakumar Yadav
  • Wicketkeeper: Sanju Samson
  • Key Players: Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel (vc), Mohammad Shami
  • Matches will be held across various venues in India including Kolkata, Chennai, Rajkot, Pune, and Mumbai.

Match Schedule:

MatchDateTimeVenue
1st T20I22-Jan-257:00 PMKolkata
2nd T20I25-Jan-257:00 PMChennai
3rd T20I28-Jan-257:00 PMRajkot
4th T20I31-Jan-257:00 PMPune
5th T20I02-Feb-257:00 PMMumbai

Notable Quotes:

“We are confident this squad will perform well against England.” - Devajit Saikia, Honorary Joint Secretary, BCCI.

This series is anticipated to be a closely contested affair, as both teams prepare to showcase their skills in the T20 format.

Team India squad for England series Live Updates: BCCI selectors reportedly pick Mohammed Shami and Dhruv Jurel - Firstpost
summary:
Team India squad for England series Highlights

Publication Date: January 11, 2025
Source: Firstpost

Mohammed Shami has made a comeback to the Indian cricket team as part of the T20I squad for the series against England, replacing wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant with Dhruv Jurel. This announcement comes as anticipation builds for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy and the home series following India’s 3-1 defeat in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Mohammed Shami returns to the Indian team after injury, marking his first appearance since the 2023 ODI World Cup.
  • Dhruv Jurel has been included in the squad over Rishabh Pant, who was not mentioned in the announcement.
  • Axar Patel has been appointed vice-captain for the T20I series.
  • Series against England includes five T20Is starting from January 22, 2025.
  • The squad has experienced significant changes post the recent Tour of Australia.
“Shami return is the talking point.” — Boria Majumdar, Twitter

The selections indicate a strategic approach by the selectors as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy.
newTitle: Highlights of Team India's Squad for the England Series: Shami Returns, Jurel Over Pant

title: From Aryan to Anaya Bangar: Sanjay Bangar's son shares his emotional transformation journey - India.com
summary:
From Aryan to Anaya Bangar: Sanjay Bangar's son shares his emotional transformation journey

Publication Date: Not provided - Source: India.com

This inspiring article chronicles the emotional transformation of Sanjay Bangar's son as he evolves from Aryan to Anaya Bangar.

  • Sanjay Bangar's son expressed his childhood struggles with gender identity.
  • He described living a double life, trying to conform to societal norms while hiding his true self.
  • After deciding to transition, he moved to the UK for support and care.
  • His journey includes challenges faced during hormone treatment and the impact on relationships.
  • Despite hardships, he found happiness and comfort in his new identity.
"I took a tough decision of taking a break from cricket and moved to UK to transition, I socially came out and found supportive friends."

His story serves as an uplifting reminder of the value of authenticity and support during times of personal change.
newTitle: Sanjay Bangar's Son Shares Emotional Journey from Aryan to Anaya

title: Nazia Bibi: first player from J&K to represent India at Kho Kho World Cup - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Nazia Bibi: First Player from J&K to Represent India at Kho Kho World Cup

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Local News

Nazia Bibi, a 21-year-old athlete from Jammu and Kashmir, has made history by being the first player from the region selected for the Indian Women’s Kho Kho team.

The upcoming tournament will feature over 20 nations and starts on January 13, 2025, at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium in New Delhi.

  • Nazia started her sports journey during her school years and has been playing professionally for the past seven years.
  • She is currently pursuing a BA at Padma Shri Padma Sachdev Govt College for Women in Jammu.
  • Her army-serving cousins inspired her passion for athletics.
  • Nazia is the only female athlete from J&K selected after a national camp.
  • Her family is immensely proud and supportive of her achievement.
  • Officials from the J&K State Kho Kho Association have praised her selection as a milestone for regional sports.
“Watching my cousins excel in athletics fueled my passion to pursue a career in sports.” - Nazia Bibi

Nazia Bibi's selection marks a significant moment for sports in Jammu and Kashmir, inspiring future generations of athletes.
newTitle: Nazia Bibi: First Player from J&K to Represent India at Kho Kho World Cup

title: "Chat GPT Product": Nitish Rana, Harshit Rana's Similar Posts Defending Gautam Gambhir After 'Hypocr.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Nitish and Harshit Rana Defend Gautam Gambhir Amid Criticism

Publication Date: January 5, 2025
Source: NDTV

Following India's 1-3 loss to Australia in a Test series, criticism has been directed toward coach Gautam Gambhir. In the wake of this, cricketers Nitish and Harshit Rana issued similar statements in defense of Gambhir, but former player Aakash Chopra commented that their posts resembled outputs from Chat GPT.

  • Gautam Gambhir faced heavy criticism after India's poor performance in the Test series.
  • Former cricketer Manoj Tiwary termed Gambhir a 'hypocrite' in his criticism.
  • Nitish and Harshit Rana expressed support for Gambhir, but their posts were strikingly similar.
  • Aakash Chopra remarked that the two posts seemed like they were generated by Chat GPT.
"If you look at it, it looks like a Chat GPT product. There are many similarities in both statements, or someone wrote them and sent them to post on social media." - Aakash Chopra

Despite a strong start to Gambhir's tenure, India has struggled in the Tests, raising questions about the team's performance and his coaching capabilities.
newTitle: Nitish and Harshit Rana Defend Gautam Gambhir Amid Criticism

title: Mohammed Shami picked for T20 series against England - The Indian Express
summary:
Mohammed Shami Returns for T20 Series Against England

Publication Date: January 11, 2025
Source: Indian Express

Fast bowler Mohammed Shami is set to return to the Indian cricket team for the upcoming T20 series against England after recovering from an ankle injury.

  • Shami last played for India in the 2023 World Cup final.
  • He underwent surgery and has been recovering, playing domestic matches in the interim.
  • The selectors have included Dhruv Jurel as the second wicketkeeper, while Rishabh Pant misses out.
  • Nitish Reddy, who performed well in Australia, is also included in the T20 squad.
  • Riyan Parag has been excluded due to injury.
“Based on the current medical assessment, the BCCI medical team has determined that his knee requires more time for controlled exposure to bowling loads.” - BCCI Release

India T20 squad: Suryakumar Yadav, Sanju Samson, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Tilak Varma, Nitish Reddy, Mohd Shami, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, Dhruv Jurel, Rinku Singh, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Ravi Bishnoi, Varun Chakravarthy, Washington Sundar.

The T20 matches against England will begin on January 22 in Kolkata.
newTitle: Mohammed Shami Returns for T20 Series Against England

title: 'Well-wishers' urged Rohit Sharma to not retire, decision upset Gautam Gambhir - The Times of India
summary:
'Well-wishers' urged Rohit Sharma to not retire, decision upset Gautam Gambhir

Date: [Publication Date]

Source: Times of India

India captain Rohit Sharma reportedly changed his mind about retiring after being urged by well-wishers, despite a disappointing run in recent matches. This decision did not sit well with coach Gautam Gambhir.

  • Rohit Sharma was set to retire after the fourth Test against Australia at the MCG.
  • He returned to open for the Boxing Day Test, pushing Shubman Gill out of the team.
  • Sharma struggled with performance, scoring just 31 runs in five innings.
  • There has been tension between Sharma and Gambhir over team decisions.
  • Sharma plans to participate in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy, which could be pivotal for senior players.
"Had his well-wishers from the outside didn't force him to change his mind, we could have well seen another retirement in Australia."

This situation highlights the ongoing challenges Sharma faces as captain and the dynamics within the team as they prepare for crucial upcoming matches.
newTitle: 'Well-wishers' urged Rohit Sharma to not retire, decision upset Gautam Gambhir

THIS, new sensation of CSK created havoc before IPL 2025, changed the match with one ball in SA20.... - India.com
summary:
THIS, new sensation of CSK created havoc before IPL 2025, changed the match with one ball in SA20....

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: india.com

In the second match of SA20 2025, a stunning performance by Noor Ahmad turned the tide, leading the Durban Super Giants to victory against Pretoria Capitals.

  • Durban Super Giants set a challenging target of 209 runs, featuring a brilliant inning by Kane Williamson.
  • Despite Pretoria Capitals appearing to be on course for an easy win, Noor Ahmad's bowling proved pivotal.
  • With critical wickets, he helped secure a narrow victory by just 2 runs for Durban.
  • Noor Ahmad was acquired by Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2025 for 10 crores, expected to be a key asset.
  • His skills are well-suited for Chennai's conditions, potentially forming a lethal spin combination with Ashwin and Jadeja.
Noor Ahmad's two crucial wickets not only turned the match but also made him a key player for CSK in IPL 2025.

This thrilling encounter has set high expectations for Noor Ahmad as he prepares to join CSK, with fans eager to see his impact in the upcoming IPL season.
newTitle: CSK's New Sensation Noor Ahmad Shines in SA20 2025

Karnataka in semis after beating Baroda in a thriller - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Karnataka Secures Semi-Final Spot by Defeating Baroda in Thrilling Match

Date: October 2023, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Karnataka won a nail-biting match against Baroda by just five runs to advance to the semi-finals of the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Devdutt Padikkal was the standout performer, scoring 102 runs.

  • Karnataka scored 281 for 8, with notable contributions from Padikkal (102) and Aneesh (52).
  • Baroda, chasing 282, was on track at 185 for 2 but lost key wickets swiftly.
  • Karnataka's wicketkeeping and fielding were crucial in turning the tide of the match.
  • Baroda's Shashwat Rawat scored a century (104) but couldn’t secure victory.
  • In a tense finish, Baroda needed 8 runs off the last two balls but fell short when Bhatt was run out.
Karnataka's catching made a massive difference to the result.

This thrilling match showcased both teams' strengths, but Karnataka's ability to defend their score under pressure ensured their place in the next round.
newTitle: Karnataka Secures Semi-Final Spot by Defeating Baroda in Thrilling Match

title: Yuvraj Singh's Old Interview Goes Viral After Virat Kohli Gets Blamed For Cutting Short His Career - NDTV Sports
summary:
Yuvraj Singh's Old Interview Goes Viral After Virat Kohli Gets Blamed For Cutting Short His Career

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

An old interview of former India player Yuvraj Singh has gone viral after ex-batter Robin Uthappa held Virat Kohli indirectly responsible for cutting short the all-rounder's international career. Uthappa claimed that Yuvraj's request for certain fitness concessions during his return to the team after beating cancer was denied by then-captain Kohli.

  • Yuvraj was one of India's finest players, contributing to the team's World Cup success in 2011.
  • After recovering from cancer, he made a comeback, scoring a hundred against England.
  • Following limited outings, he decided to retire in 2019 after feeling sidelined.
“Never thought that I would be dropped after being the Man of the Match in 2 games... I was told to prepare for the Sri Lanka series. Then suddenly, the Yo-Yo test came into the picture.” - Yuvraj Singh

This controversy highlights issues within team management decisions and the treatment of players faced with challenging circumstances.
newTitle: Yuvraj Singh's Old Interview Goes Viral After Virat Kohli Gets Blamed For Cutting Short His Career
